demos.answer1: Antonio Vivaldi and Johann Sebastian Bach
demos.answer2: Antonio Vivaldi (violin concertos), Johann Pachelbel (organ works)
The title of Petrarch's famous collection of poetry is "Rerum vulgarium fragmenta", often known as "Il Canzoniere" in Italian. It includes his sonnets to Laura.
"The Pit and the Pendulum" by Edgar Allan Poe.
As of 2022, it has been approximately 205 years since the founding of the city of Pittsburgh, Pennsylvania. The city was incorporated on March 18, 1816.

generate_answer.signature_instructions: Given two answers, your goal is to determine whether the two answers are semantically equivalent and thus equal to each other. Output 1 if the answers are equivalent and 0 if they are not equivalent.
